DataElement.preferredName: Disease Progression Free Last Verification Less Enrollment Date Calculation Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The number of days from the date the patient was enrolled on the study to the date the patient was last verified to be free of progression [manually curated].

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Negation Disease Progression Last Verification Subtraction Enrollment Time Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._The worsening of a disease over time._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._Support or establish by evidence or proof._The act of removing a part from the whole._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Negation Disease Progression Last Verification Subtraction Enrollment Time
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:The worsening of a disease over time.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:Support or establish by evidence or proof.:The act of removing a part from the whole.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
Support or establish by evidence or proof.
The act of removing a part from the whole.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Needed new DEC for new CDE: "Progression Free Survival (PFS): Total number of days since study enrollment"

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Calculation created for TCGA content requested by Dr. Ari Kahn.  This VD uses a calculation of dividing a value by the number of milliseconds in a day (86,400,000) to result in a number of days, stored as a whole number.
